snippet: Companies are wielding patents as weapons in a blizzard of intellectual property lawsuits, which could have a devastating effect on society as a whole by short-circuiting innovation.
abstract: Eduardo Porter Economic Scene column warns that patent litigation could stifle innovation in the technology sector; says that companies are wielding patents and intellectual property as weapons and a way to stay ahead of the competition, giving a distinct advantage to larger, more financially sound businesses, and intimidating start-ups from pushing forward good ideas and improving on existing ones.

snippet: Prosecutors contend that Rajat K. Gupta told Raj Rajaratnam about two Procter & Gamble secrets: the sale of its Folgers coffee business, and its announcement about disappointing sales growth in 2009.
abstract: Prosecutors contend that Rajat K. Gupta told Raj Rajaratnam about two Procter & Gamble secrets: the sale of its Folgers coffee business, and its announcement about disappointing sales growth in 2009.

headline.main: P.&G. Takes Center Stage at Gupta Trial
headline.print_headline: Ex-Galleon Trader Plays Big Role in Insider Case

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PETER LATTMAN

snippet: Shares of the social networking company are now down 24 percent from their initial public offering earlier this month.
abstract: Shares of Facebook continue to fall sharply, even as stocks on Wall Street move solidly higher; the stock is now 24 percent below its initial offering price of $38, a sign that the bottom is yet to come as options trading begins.

headline.main: Overall Market Turns Up While Facebook Slides
headline.print_headline: Overall Market Turns Up While Facebook Slides

snippet: Shares in the Norwegian Internet browser company Opera Software rose by as much as 22 percent on Tuesday after reports surfaced that Facebook might be looking to buy the company.
abstract: Shares in the Norwegian Internet browser company Opera Software rose by as much as 22 percent on Tuesday after reports surfaced that Facebook might be looking to buy the company.

headline.main: Talk of Facebook Interest Drives Shares in European Web Browser

snippet: Skype must be able to give Windows and other Microsoft products an edge for Microsoft to justify the $8.5 billion it paid. One important milestone will come this year, when Skype is expected to release a preliminary version of its calling software...
abstract: Skype must be able to give Windows and other Microsoft products an edge for Microsoft to justify the $8.5 billion it paid. One important milestone will come this year, when Skype is expected to release a preliminary version of its calling software that runs on Windows 8, an overhaul of Microsoft's flagship operating system intended to work well with touch-screen computers.

headline.main: Daily Report: $8.5 Billion Skype Deal Presents a Puzzle

snippet: Skype must be able to give Windows and other Microsoft products an edge for Microsoft to justify the $8.5 billion it paid, analysts said.
abstract: Analysts say Microsoft's $8.5 billion acquisition of Internet calling service Skype will ultimately be judged by whether Microsoft can weave the product into its vast portfolio; contend Skype must be able to give Windows and other Microsoft products an edge to justify the price it paid.

headline.main: $8.5 Billion Deal for Calling Service Presents a Puzzle

snippet: Is there a correlation between growing sales of Greek yogurt in the United States and the worsening Greek economic crisis?
abstract: Stuart Elliott Advertising column asks 20 questions about advertising, the media and popular culture.

headline.main: Asking About Big Joe Turner, Suzy Q and Black Dahlia

snippet: 8:40 p.m. | Updated      Michael Cardillo was a low-level trader barely known outside of his firm before he was accused of insider trading. Now, he could end up playing a major role in the trial of Rajat K. Gupta, a member of the global business e...
abstract: Former Galleon Group trader Michael Cardillo could end up playing a major role in the insider trading trial of Rajat K Gupta; Cardillo's testimony is said to be crucial in convincing jurors of the charges against Gupta. Photo (M)3

headline.main: Ex-Galleon Trader Plays Big Role in Insider Case

byline.original: By AZAM AHMED and PETER LATTMAN

snippet: In response to a Justice Department lawsuit, the two book publishers denied any price fixing for e-books and accuse Amazon of engaging in anticompetitive behavior.
abstract: Book publishers Penguin Group USA and Macmillan, in response to a Justice Department lawsuit accusing five publishers of conspiring with Apple to fix the price of e-books, deny any e-book price fixing and accuse Amazon of engaging in anticompetitive behavior. (M)

headline.main: 2 Publishers Deny Claim of E-Book Price Fixing

snippet: E-readers are more impressive than ever, and the prices have fallen because of improved technologies.

headline.main: Books Under Glass: The Many Faces Of E-Readers
